complementary adjective
(COLOURS)
art, physics
  specialized (of colours) producing black or white when combined, and making a very strong contrast when placed next to each other: In modern colour theory, the complementary pairs are red–cyan, green–magenta, and blue–yellow. Artists began to note that shadows are the complementary colour of the light that throws them, so yellow sunlight throws a violet shadow.
More examplesFewer examplesComplementary colours appear opposite each other on the colour wheel.
